articles.title: About Me
articles.contents:
Yuta Kanzawa
Job: Data scientist
Location: Tokyo, Japan
Languages: Japanese, English, German, R, Python, SQL, SAS
Bio: Data Scientist at Zurich Insurance in Tokyo. I have more than
10 years of experience and have worked at Janssen Pharmaceutical (a
family company of Johnson & Johnson) and Zurich Insurance,
collaborating successfully with commercial colleagues and senior
management to deliver strategic insights and support decision making
through data science.

articles.title: Yuta Kanzawa, Data Scientist
articles.description: Hello! I'm a data scientist based in Tokyo working on applied machine learning, business intelligence and data visualisation. Always under construction.
articles.contents:

'); // onClick function for all plots (img's) $('img:not(.zoomImg)').click(function() { $('.zoomImg').attr('src', $(this).attr('src')).css({width: '100%'}); $('.zoomDiv').css({opacity: '1', width: 'auto', border: '1px solid white', borderRadius: '5px', position: 'fixed', top: '55%', left: '50%', marginRight: '-50%', transform: 'translate(-50%, -50%)', boxShadow: '0px 0px 50px #888888', zIndex: '50', overflow: 'auto', maxHeight: '90%'}); }); // onClick function for zoomImg $('img.zoomImg').click(function() { $('.zoomDiv').css({opacity: '0', width: '0%'}); }); }); Data Visualisations Data Analyses Toilet paper situations in the world (Global Data Science Project for COVID-19, published on 18th May 2020, updated in June 2020) Wagner2Vek: Die Meistersinger von Nürnberg (July 2019) データで振り返る Python mini-Hack-a-thon 100回の歴史 (June - July 2019) OSS Matplotlib backend implementation for Optuna visualisation functions (August 2020 - Now) Japanese translation of a fast.ai article “Covid-19, your community, and you — a data science perspective” (Published on 16th March 2020, updated on 19th March 2020) Japanese translation of Stanford Cheat Sheets for ML, DL, Statistics (with MLT members, August - October 2019) Talks R 初心者セッション：R & RStudio入門Beginner session: R & RStudio 101 (Japanese) (Tokyo.R, 22nd October 2022) 初心者セッション：データ可視化Beginner session: Data Visualisation (Japanese) (Tokyo.R, 17th September 2022) カラーユニバーサルデザイン入門Colour Universal Design 101 (Japanese) (Tokyo.R, 23rd January 2021) 日本の年平均気温図を作ってみた話 (Japan.R, 5th December 2020) 初心者セッション：データ可視化Beginner session: Data Visualisation (Japanese) (Tokyo.R, 1st August 2020) 日本の気象観測データの（オープンなようでオープンでない）話 (Tokyo.R, 27th June 2020) 国土数値情報APIのススメ (Tokyo.R, 4th April 2020) tidyverse（再）入門(Re-)Introduction to tidyverse (Japanese) (Japan.R, 7th December 2019) ドイツのPyConでR（とPython）の話をしてきた話 (Tokyo.R, 26th October 2019) Python データサイエンスのためのリーダブルコードのススメReadable Code for Data Science (Japanese) (PyCon mini Hiroshima, 10th October 2020) Pythonでggplotってみた話 (Pythonもくもく自習室, 15th August 2020) Pythonで見る私の行動変容 −COVID-19前後の比較−Evaluate Personal Behavioural Change with Python: Comparison before and after COVID-19 Breakout (Japanese) (Python Charity Talks in Japan, 4th July 2020) サンキーダイアグラムのススメ (PyData Fukuoka, 7th June 2020) Friend or Foe: Comparison of R & Python in Data Wrangling & Visualisation (English) (PyCon DE & PyData Berlin 2019, 11th October 2019) Misc オペラのお話An Opera Talk (Japanese) (BeProud Learning Lunch, 16th June 2020) AI Open Education: Stanford Deep Learning Cheat Sheets in Japanese (English) (Code Chrysalis x Machine Learning Tokyo MiniConf, 30th October 2019) Archive To be updated.
